p: Vaccination activities considered in the EYE strategy consist of routine immunization of infants, preventive mass vaccination campaigns (PMVCs) that target all or most age groups, preventive catch-up campaigns targeting specific cohorts or unvaccinated sub-populations, and reactive campaigns in outbreak situations. Local assessment of YF transmission intensity is key for the prioritization of each of these vaccination activities; particularly since the supply of vaccine is limited as seen during the 2016 Angola outbreak [ 6, 7]. Vaccine demand forecasts are critical to shape vaccine production and ensure optimal vaccine allocation.
